greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let k = A228058(n). a(n) is the number of ways to partition the divisors of k into complementary subsets x and y so that the (k-Sum(x)) and (k-Sum(y)) are coprime.
comment: The smallest value known so far occurs as a(449) = 6. A228058(449) = 23837 = 11^2 * 197.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1158
program: A228058list(up_to) = { my(v=vector(up_to), k=0, n=0); while(k<up_to, n++; if(isA228058(n), k++; v[k] = n)); (v); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 25 2019
